subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ムグラ}} {| style="float:right;padding:0px;margin-right:-5px;clear:both;" | [[File:Sherardia_arvensis4.jpg|thumb|none|118px|{{m|ja|花八重葎|tr=hana yae mugura}}: the “flowering eight-layer '''''mugura'''''”, {{vern|field madder}}.]] | [[File:Hedyotis_biflora_var_parvifolia_flower02.jpg|thumb|none|119px|{{m|ja|磯馴葎|tr=sonare mugura}}: the “pebble-accustomed '''''mugura'''''”, {{taxlink|Hedyotis biflora|species|noshow=1}}.]] |- | [[File:Humulus_Japonicus_14OCT2007.jpg|thumb|none|119px|{{m|ja|金葎|tr=kana mugura}}: the “money '''''mugura'''''”, the [[Japanese hop]] plant.]] | [[File:Galium.mollugo.5961.Liosi.jpg|thumb|none|118px|{{m|ja|刺無葎|tr=toge nashi mugura}}: the “thornless '''''mugura'''''”, {{vern|false baby's breath}}.]] |}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|むぐら}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=むぐら}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} Probably the eastern Japanese form. Compare the alternation in ''ugura'' and ''mugura'' readings in the etymology of {{m|ja|土竜}}. May ultimately derive from obsolete verb {{m|ja|剥る|tr=mukuru||to peel off, to tear off}}, perhaps related to the way that [[weed]]s are often removed by tearing the plant out.

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うぐら}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うぐら}}. Probably the western Japanese form. Compare the alternation in ''ugura'' and ''mugura'' readings in the etymology of {{m|ja|土竜}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|うぐら}}

# any of various [[plant]]s of [[order]] ''[[Gentianales]]'' or ''[[Urticales]]'', that form [[thicket]]s, often have [[thorn]]s and form [[vine]]s, and prefer [[wet]] or [[disturbed]] soils; generally regarded as [[weed]]s

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|もぐら}}
Probably an alteration or dialectal variant of ''mugura'' above. Appears with this reading in the {{lang|ja|本草和名}} (''Honzō Wamyō'', “Japanese Names of the Real Herbs”), a [[pharmacopoeia]] written in 923.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Still listed as an alternate reading in modern dictionaries.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|もぐら}}

# Any of various [[plant]]s of [[order]] [[Gentianales]] or [[Urticales]], that form [[thicket]]s, often have [[thorn]]s and form [[vine]]s, and prefer [[wet]] or [[disturbed]] soils; generally regarded as [[weed]]s
